event.title: 2010 census, Mount Pleasant's population was 15,564; it is situated

data.event: As of the 2010 census, Mount Pleasant's population was 15,564; it is situated in Northeast Texas.
Mount Pleasant was founded May 11, 1848, to serve as county seat for Titus County, which was created by a legislative act on May 11, 1846.

event.title: was created by a legislative act on May 11, 1846

data.event: Mount Pleasant was founded May 11, 1848, to serve as county seat for Titus County, which was created by a legislative act on May 11, 1846.

event.title: halted travel in the early years

data.event: High waters along the creeks and the Sulphur River often halted travel in the early years.
